intro: Psychotria turbinella var. sororiella, commonly known as the "sister psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. The plant is notable for its potential medicinal properties and has been studied for its alkaloid content.
